<details class="orc-details-panel">
<summary><i class="bi bi-folder2-open"></i> Research Data Management Plans</summary>

A Research Data Management (RDM) plan documents how you will acquire, store, use, and share your research data. Draft it early - much of the content will be needed for ethics approval. Your DMP is a living document that evolves with your project. Funders may require a DMP at proposal stage or project completion.

**Collecting new data?** Write your RDM plan before submitting your ethics proposal. The plan helps structure your consent forms and data handling procedures.

**Using existing data?** Review the dataset's metadata and codebook first. Check any data use agreements and understand how the data was collected.

**What to include in your DMP:**

<div class="orc-grid-tools">

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-file-earmark-text"></i> Data Description</strong>
<ul>
<li>Types and file formats</li>
<li>Expected volume and growth</li>
<li>Naming conventions</li>
<li>Versioning approach</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-shield-check"></i> Storage & Security</strong>
<ul>
<li>Storage locations</li>
<li>3-2-1 backup rule</li>
<li>Access controls</li>
<li>Encryption requirements</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-share"></i> Sharing & Preservation</strong>
<ul>
<li>Repository selection</li>
<li>License choices</li>
<li>Embargo periods</li>
<li>10-year preservation (LMU)</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="orc-card">
<strong><i class="bi bi-key"></i> Ethics & Privacy</strong>
<ul>
<li>Consent procedures</li>
<li>Anonymization methods</li>
<li>GDPR compliance</li>
<li>Data use agreements</li>
</ul>
</div>

</div>
